intro: Draba torticarpa, commonly known as the twisted-stemed whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in alpine and arctic environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Draba torticarpa is known for its low-growing habit and its ability to survive in harsh, cold climates. Its leaves are usually basal, linear, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs.
